## MATHEMATICS

9709/31  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 771, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(4|5^{x} - 1| = 5^{x}\), giving your answers correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Express \(5 \sin x - 3 \cos x\) in the form \(R \sin (x - \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0 < \alpha < \frac{1}{2}\pi\). Give the exact value of \(R\) and give \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 599, 185, 617]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 599, 725, 618]]<|/det|>
Hence state the greatest and least possible values of \((5 \sin x - 3 \cos x)^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 597, 920, 616]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 541, 92]]<|/det|>
Using the substitution \(u = \sqrt{x}\), find the exact value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 98, 574, 138]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{3}^{\infty}\frac{1}{(x + 1)\sqrt{x}}\mathrm{d}x.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 112, 920, 129]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 344, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 94, 571, 112]]<|/det|>
\[\cot 2\theta +\cot \theta = 2\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 116, 551, 135]]<|/det|>
can be expressed as a quadratic equation in \(\tan \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 116, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 556, 191, 574]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 555, 920, 592]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\cot 2\theta +\cot \theta = 2\), for \(0< \theta < \pi\), giving your answers correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 572, 920, 591]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
When \((a + bx)\sqrt{1 + 4x}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants, is expanded in ascending powers of \(x\), the coefficients of \(x\) and \(x^{2}\) are 3 and \(-6\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 332, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 425, 92]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y = \ln (\ln x)\), show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 98, 551, 131]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{1}{x\ln x}. \quad [1]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 330, 541, 350]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(t\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 356, 566, 386]]<|/det|>
\[x\ln x + t\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = 0.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 393, 376, 412]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(x = \mathrm{e}\) when \(t = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 425, 148, 443]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 425, 920, 458]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation obtaining an expression for \(x\) in terms of \(t\), simplifying your answer. [7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 477, 920, 496]]<|/det|>
<form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 106, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(1 + 2\mathrm{i}\) is denoted by \(u\). The polynomial \(2x^{3} + ax^{2} + 4x + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are real constants, is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). It is given that \(u\) is a root of the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 120, 373, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 752, 186, 770]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 752, 517, 771]]<|/det|>
State a second complex root of this equation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 753, 920, 771]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 386, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the real factors of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[166, 479, 920, 515]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label> On a sketch of an Argand diagram, shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) satisfying the inequalities \(|z - u| \leqslant \sqrt{5}\) and \(\arg z \leqslant \frac{1}{4}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 496, 920, 514]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 734, 920, 769]]<|/det|>
